@description.name: @description
@description.body:
A line tag is used to display a horizontal line in the browser to allow for a grouped and thereby tidy display of elements on one page. To specify the width of the line an optional <layout/>-child can be added.

A line tag which uses 50% of the screen size (6 of 12 available columns)
<line>
  <layout colspan="6"/>
</line>
Christian Mayer
0.8.0 (2012)

@widgetexample.name: @widgetexample
@widgetexample.body:
<settings selector="hr">
   <caption>A line tag which uses 50% of the screen size (6 of 12 available columns)</caption>
 </settings>
 <line><layout colspan="6"/></line>

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property styling. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #styling}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property styling. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #styling}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property styling. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #styling}.
